intro: Chesneya vaginalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf chesneya, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Chesneya vaginalis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
